title: A Village Named for Spanish Dictator Tries to Erase Its Origins
text:
GUADIANA DEL CAUDILLO, Spain—A little over four decades since Gen. Francisco Franco’s death, Spain is wrestling with the dictator’s legacy, no more so than in this village named in his honor.

Laid out in neat rows of mostly one or two-storey whitewashed buildings, Guadiana del Caudillo bears Franco’s self-imposed title of Caudillo, or Leader. Construction began in the late 1940s, in the first decade of Franco’s 36-year dictatorship, alongside other villages also named after Franco or people close to him.

...
description: As Spain prepares to exhume Franco, a village bearing his title is trying to shake free of his memory.
